<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 490, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 558, 482, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 573, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 216, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 873, 92]]<|/det|>
A line has equation \(y = 3x - 2k\) and a curve has equation \(y = x^{2} - kx + 2\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 569, 123]]<|/det|>
Show that the line and the curve meet for all values of \(k\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
A function f is defined by \(\operatorname {f}(x) = x^{2} - 2x + 5\) for \(x \in \mathbb{R}\). A sequence of transformations is applied in the following order to the graph of \(y = \operatorname {f}(x)\) to give the graph of \(y = \operatorname {g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 120, 536, 140]]<|/det|>
Stretch parallel to the \(x\)-axis with scale factor \(\frac{1}{2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 149, 346, 168]]<|/det|>
Reflection in the \(y\)-axis

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 177, 536, 196]]<|/det|>
Stretch parallel to the \(y\)-axis with scale factor 3

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 208, 138, 227]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 207, 808, 227]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{g}(x)\), giving your answer in the form \(a x^{2} + b x + c\), where \(a, b\) and \(c\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 208, 920, 227]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 724, 94]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{1}{60} (3x + 1)^2\) and a point is moving along the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 920, 140]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of the point on the curve at which the \(x\)- and \(y\)-coordinates are increasing at the same rate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The circumference round the trunk of a large tree is measured and found to be \(5.00 \text{m}\). After one year the circumference is measured again and found to be \(5.02 \text{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
Given that the circumferences at yearly intervals form an arithmetic progression, find the circumference 20 years after the first measurement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 135, 920, 154]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 504, 186, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 504, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
Given instead that the circumferences at yearly intervals form a geometric progression, find the circumference 20 years after the first measurement.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 526, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 890, 92]]<|/det|>
Points \(A\) (7, 12) and \(B\) lie on a circle with centre \((-2, 5)\). The line \(AB\) has equation \(y = -2x + 26\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 328, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the coordinates of \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 79, 97, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 485, 104]]<|/det|>
In the expansion of \(\left(\frac{x}{a} + \frac{a}{x^2}\right)^7\), it is given that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 114, 599, 152]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{the~coefficient~of~}x^{4}}{\mathrm{the~coefficient~of~}x} = 3.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 166, 455, 186]]<|/det|>
Find the possible values of the constant \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 186]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 437, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 556, 92]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = -x^{2} - 1\) for \(x \leqslant -1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 104, 482, 122]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{fg}(x) - \mathrm{gf}(x) + 8 = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 104, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
At the point (4, \(-1\)) on a curve, the gradient of the curve is \(- \frac{3}{2}\). It is given that \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}} = x^{-\frac{1}{2}} + k\), where \(k\) is a constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 131, 144, 149]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 129, 304, 149]]<|/det|>
Show that \(k = -2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 149]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 306, 146, 324]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 306, 405, 325]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 306, 920, 325]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

The diagram shows the curve with equation \(x = y^{2} + 1\). The points \(A\) (5, 2) and \(B\) (2, \(-1\)) lie on the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 361, 146, 380]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 361, 415, 380]]<|/det|>
Find an equation of the line \(AB\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 361, 920, 380]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 570, 146, 588]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 570, 920, 604]]<|/det|>
Find the volume of revolution when the region between the curve and the line \(AB\) is rotated through \(360^{\circ}\) about the \(y\)-axis.
